contentrichtext.text: '''Ripley''' is a small, [[unincorporated community]] in [[Franklin Township, Houghton County, Michigan|Franklin Township]] situated upon a slope, just east of [[Hancock, Michigan|Hancock]] on [[M-26 (Michigan highway)|M-26]] and across the [[Portage Lake Canal]] from [[Houghton, Michigan|Houghton]]. A [[ski resort]] called [[Mont Ripley]] is located in Ripley. The now-closed [[Quincy Smelter|Quincy Smelting Works]], formerly operated by the [[Quincy Mine]], is also located in Ripley.<ref>http://digarch.lib.mtu.edu/showbib.aspx?bib_id=623671#</ref> ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== * [http://digarch.lib.mtu.edu/showbib.aspx?bib_id=597156# View of Ripley from Houghton] * [http://digarch.lib.mtu.edu/showbib.aspx?bib_id=620026# View of the Portage Lake Lift Bridge and Portage Lake from Ripley] {{coord|47|07|36|N|88|33|13|W|display=title}} [[Category:Unincorporated communities in Houghton County, Michigan]] [[Category:Houghton, Michigan micropolitan area]]
